meanings.sent1: The northmost point of the map is where the compass points.
meanings.sent2: The northmost house on the street always gets the most snow in winter.
meanings.sent3: The penguins decided to have a party at the northmost iceberg.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the northmost star, guiding her through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The northmost region of the country was known for its stunning auroras.

meanings.sent1: The explorers set out to reach the northmost village in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The northmost part of the forest was untouched by human hands.
meanings.sent3: The snowman at the northmost edge of the yard looked lonely.
meanings.sent4: The northmost tree in the orchard stood tall against the icy winds.
meanings.sent5: The northmost cabin in the woods provided a peaceful retreat.
